newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil ends mixed in rangebound deal.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil ends mixed in rangebound deal.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICAL

PALM OIL FUTURES -Prices closed mixed in rangebound trading due to players' reluctance to trade amid uncertainty in near-term trend. The markwt was still concerned over PORLA data released yesterday. Activity picked up because of some covering among Sept and Aug futures. Near-term trend seen uncertain. Sept support at 1,150 and resistance 1,170.
PALM OIL PHYSICALS - Interest was seen scattered among products, with the trend following futures.
"There is basically a lack of liquidity this morning," a trader said. "Nobody is keen to trade heavily as people are digesting over the PORLA numbers yesterday."

Palm Oil Registration and Licensing Authority (PORLA) announced a smaller than expected end-May stocks but this did not aid the market. End-May stocks were at 711,841 tonnes against trade estimates of 740,000 tonnes.
"The undertone is still bearish and little price movement is expected until a clear path emerges," said another trader.
September futures contract is seen trying to trade in range of 1,156 and 1,168 ringgit.
September futures contract was up seven ringgit at 1,168 ringgit ($464.41) a tonne.
Physicals June/July (south) crude palm oil saw offers at 1,210 ringgit against bids at 1,205. No trades were reported.
In refined products, June/July RBD palm oil was offered at $507.50 and Aug/Sept at $505. June was traded at $502.50 and Aug/Sept at $502.50.
June RBD palm olein saw offers at $552.50, July at $550 and Aug/Sept at $547.50. June was traded at $550 and July at $547.50.
July RBD palm stearin was offered at $382.50, Aug/Sept at $380 and July/Aug palm fatty acid distillate saw sellers at $280.
